createInstance

public static DatabaseClient createInstance(Database db)
Creates new ActiveRecord instance. Returned instances is not initially opened. Calling application must explicitly open it by calling open() method

copyFrom

public void copyFrom(java.lang.Object src)
Copies values of fields from src to current object. Scans src object for the fields with the same names as in current object and copies it's valies. All fields are copied except special fields: 'id', 'created', 'modified', and also fields prefixed as 'm_*' and 's_' If src has fields not defiend in current object such fields are ignored

Parameters:
src -

setDatabase

public void setDatabase(Database database)
Call this once at application launch, sets the database to use for AREntities.

Parameters:
database - The database to use.

delete

public <T extends DatabaseClient> int delete(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                             java.lang.String whereClause,
                                             java.lang.String[] whereArgs)
           throws DBException
Delete selected entities from the database.

Type Parameters:
T - Any AREntity class.
Parameters:
type - The class of the entities to delete.
whereClause - The condition to match (Don't include "where").
whereArgs - The arguments to replace "?" with.
Returns:
The number of rows affected.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.InstantiationException
DBException

                                                     java.lang.String column,
                                                     java.lang.String value)
                   throws DBException
Delete all instances of an entity from the database where a column has a specified value.

Type Parameters:

Parameters:

column - The column to match.
value - The value required for deletion.

find

public <T extends DatabaseClient> java.util.List<T> find(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                                         java.lang.String whereClause,
                                                         java.lang.String[] whereArgs)
                                              throws DBException
Return all instances of an entity that match the given criteria. Use whereClause to specify condition, using reqular SQL syntax for WHERE clause.

For example selecting all JOHNs born in 2001 from USERS table may look like: 

 users.find(Users.class, "NAME='?' and YEAR=?", new String[] {"John", "2001"});

Type Parameters:
T - Any ActiveRecordBase class.
Parameters:
type - The class of the entities to return.
whereClause - The condition to match (Don't include "where").
whereArgs - The arguments to replace "?" with.
Returns:
A generic list of all matching entities.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.InstantiationException
DBException

findByColumn

public <T extends DatabaseClient> java.util.List<T> findByColumn(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                                                 java.lang.String column,
                                                                 java.lang.String value)
                                                      throws DBException
Return all instances of an entity from the database where a column has a specified value.

Type Parameters:
T - Any ActiveRecordBase class.
Parameters:
type - The class of the entities to return.
column - The tables's column to match. Note - it must be name from DB schema, not Java field name
value - The desired value.
Returns:
A generic list of all matching entities.
Throws:
DBException

                                             long id)
                                  throws DBException
Return the instance of an entity with a matching id.

Type Parameters:
T - Any ActiveRecordBase class.
Parameters:
type - The class of the entity to return.
id - The desired ID.
Returns:
The matching entity if reocrd found in DB, null otherwise
Throws:
DBException
